domainElements.description: The 64-bit natural numbers
domainElements.name: hdole/Narithmetics/t_0

domainElements.description:
The addition of two natural numbers.
Note that there is no detection of overflow.
domainElements.name: hdole/Narithmetics/t_6

domainElements.description:
The multiplication of two natural numbers.
Note that there is no detection of overflow.
domainElements.name: hdole/Narithmetics/t_7

domainElements.description:
The successor function for the natural numbers.
As it happens, the natural number objects are finite
and so the last natural number does not have a successor.
Instead, an "exception" is thrown for the last natural number
to the one point set.
domainElements.name: hdole/Narithmetics/t_8

domainElements.description:
The decrement function for the natural numbers.
Note that zero cannot be decremented and so is mapped
to the one point set.
domainElements.name: hdole/Narithmetics/t_9

elements.description: every sixteen bit natural number is a natural number

code.cpp: void %Type(const %Dom & args, %Cod & out) { out = 0; }
void %Type(const %Dom & args, %Cod & out) { out = 1; }
void %Type(const %Dom & args, %Cod & out) { out = 65535; }
